bill_title: Congratulating and honoring the Lennox archery team for winning the South Dakota State Archery Championship.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Congratulating and honoring the Lennox archery team for winning the South Dakota State Archery Championship. WHEREAS, the Lennox archery team claimed the South Dakota State Archery Championship for the second year in a row; and WHEREAS, the Lennox archery team competed in the state shoot against thirty-seven other school districts, with a total of 540 students; and WHEREAS, the Lennox archery team had an individual, Josh Goeman, who won individual state honors with his score of 269: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Eighty-Ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Legislature congratulates the Lennox archery team for winning the South Dakota State Archery Championship as well as Josh Goeman for winning individual state honors, recognizes their outstanding hard work and determination, and extends best wishes for their continued success and happiness.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Congratulating and honoring the Lennox archery team for winning the South Dakota State Archery Championship. WHEREAS, the Lennox archery team claimed the South Dakota State Archery Championship for the second year in a row; and WHEREAS, the Lennox archery team competed in the state shoot against thirty-seven other school districts, with a total of 540 students; and WHEREAS, the Lennox archery team had an individual, Josh Goeman, who won individual state honors with his score of 269: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Eighty-Ninth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that the Legislature congratulates the Lennox archery team for winning the South Dakota State Archery Championship as well as Josh Goeman for winning individual state honors, recognizes their outstanding hard work and determination, and extends best wishes for their continued success and happiness. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
